channel.title: Finance
channel.description: Latest investing news and finance headlines straight from Wall Street.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves in the premarket: Oatly, Tesla, Dollar Tree and more
item.description: The stocks making the biggest moves in premarket trading include Oatly, Tesla, Dollar Tree, and more.

item.title: Dow and S&P 500 are higher to start the week, Nasdaq Composite slips
item.description: Stocks are coming off a losing week after October's consumer price index saw its largest annual increase in more than three decades.

item.title: Top tech investor Paul Meeks won’t put new money to work in Apple and other FAANG names, blames chip shortage that could extend through 2023
item.description: Paul Meeks, who ran the world’s largest tech fund during the dot-com bubble, suggests Wall Street is underestimating supply chain backlogs.

item.title: Quit a job? You likely can't collect unemployment benefits
item.description: Americans are quitting their jobs in record numbers. They generally can't count on unemployment benefits as a financial buffer.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Tesla, Lordstown Motors, Warby Parker and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Johnson & Johnson, Rivian, Lordstown and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: China slams U.S. democracy as a 'game of the rich,' at an event promoting Xi's growing power
item.description: The remarks come as Chinese President Xi Jinping became the third leader to oversee the politically significant approval of a "historical resolution" this week.

item.title: Central bank digital currencies are a long way from becoming reality — unless you’re in China
item.description: Rising interest in cryptocurrencies has reignited central banks' digital currency ambitions. But so far, most CBDC projects are moving at a sluggish pace.

item.title: Experts say the 4% rule, a popular retirement income strategy, is outdated
item.description: Average stock and bond returns aren't expected to be as robust in coming decades, and retirees may have to reduce withdrawals from their nest eggs.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Rivian, Beyond Meat, Disney and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: Major Wall Street firm has one of its largest equity overweights ever - and is looking to buy even more stocks
item.description: Wilmington Trust's Meghan Shue explains why her firm has been piling into stocks and what she would buy on weakness.

item.title: Nasdaq rebounds after inflation-driven sell-off, Disney weighs on the Dow
item.description: The Nasdaq Composite rebounded Thursday after hot inflation data and surging bond yields sparked a sell-off in technology stocks in the previous session.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Disney, Beyond Meat, Affirm Holdings and more
item.description: See which stocks are posting big moves after the bell on Wednesday.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Mastercard, Unity Software, Wendy's and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: McKinsey partner is charged with insider trading tied to Goldman Sachs' acquisition of GreenSky
item.description: A federal complaint unsealed Wednesday charges McKinsey partner Puneet Dikshit with insider trading in his client Goldman Sachs' acquisition of GreenSky.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Coinbase, DoorDash, Poshmark and more
item.description: See which stocks are posting big moves before the bell.

item.title: UK buy now, pay later start-up quadruples valuation to $2 billion, plans U.S. expansion
item.description: British start-up Zilch is riding the "buy now, pay later" wave to America.

item.title: JPMorgan turns bullish on UK stocks for the first time since the Brexit vote
item.description: JPMorgan on Monday upgraded U.K. stocks to "overweight," ending years of caution on British equity markets.

item.title: Xi says China is ready to work with U.S. on condition of 'mutual respect'
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping sent a letter to a U.S. political advisory group ahead of a widely expected virtual meeting with U.S. President Joe Biden.

item.title: Dow drops 240 points, Nasdaq falls 1.7% after hot inflation data drives bond yield spike
item.description: Stocks retreated Wednesday after October's consumer price reading showing the biggest annual jump in more than 30 years.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Coinbase, Poshmark, DoorDash and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in after hours trading.

item.title: Thousands of Americans living abroad got stimulus checks. Here’s why
item.description: The IRS issued $5.5 billion of stimulus payments outside the 50 states and Washington, D.C. Tax policy experts say there's good reason for doing so.

item.title: Ousted WeWork CEO says $47 billion valuation went to his head before botched IPO
item.description: Adam Neumann gave his first interview since WeWork's failed IPO two years ago.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: General Electric, PayPal, Roblox and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: London Stock Exchange aims to bring firms' carbon claims 'out into daylight'
item.description: CEO Julia Hoggett said the LSE is aiming to make carbon markets more visible.

item.title: Ripple to launch crypto service for financial companies amid legal battle with the SEC
item.description: Ripple is set to launch a product called Liquidity Hub that allows financial services firms to offer their customers access to cryptocurrencies.

item.title: Child tax credit scams still trapping the unwary
item.description: The IRS is issuing monthly payments of the enhanced child tax credit through 2021. Scammers are posing as government agents to steal money and personal data.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: GE, Palantir, PayPal and more
item.description: Here are the companies making headlines before the bell on Tuesday.

item.title: China's property market could see more pain, even as Evergrande crisis seems to be abating
item.description: Worries about Chinese real estate developers' high debt levels rattled investors despite signs Evergrande was making progress on resolving its problems.

item.title: Market bull Tony Dwyer sees the record breakout running through year end
item.description: Canaccord’s Tony Dwyer expects the major indexes to benefit from strong optimism and the Federal Reserve’s easy money policies.
